summary: Have been good for me
pros:
Big tech and all the associated goodies

All FAANG goodies
cons:
Slow career progression in general

Not as many perks like other FAANG

summary: Please strongly consider other options for your own health
pros:
Decent comp compared to some of the other companies
Barista coffee
cons:
- Overworked that you won’t even find time to interview outside too
- Ingrained political mindset people all over the company just looking to pull other people down
- 5 days RTO commute
- Working here might result in your bloodwork going bad very soon

summary: Comp can be good based on stock price
pros: Can work on cutting edge projects and innovate, so lots of opportunities to learn
cons: Weak management, toxic culture, high red tape and unnecessary rework can make life very frustrating.

summary: It’s a sh*t show
pros:
Good benefits 
Good comp if you are constantly performing at top tier
cons:
Internal politics 
Micro management 
Lack of vision 
Forced attrition 
No promotions

summary: Great pace and learning; out if not fully tuned in.
pros:
Amazing Scale - Learn a lot.
Create products that are amazing to show off to friends and family
If you are fully tuned in, and give it your 110%, rise the ranks fast
cons:
The company will take as much as you give it, no limits
A lot of your experience will depend on your leadership chain
People who have been here for a ling time exactly know how to weaponize Leadership Principles to get what they want.

summary: Great experience to have on your resume.
pros: A great company to have on your resume, early in your career. You'll get the chance to interact and work with some great minds and irrespective of what everyone says, you'll get respect and admiration points from people around you when you tell them that work at Amazon.
cons: Extremely cut throat environment, inter and intra team politics. You'll be extremely replaceable and can expect very huge changes in company policies. While Initial comp is good. Don't expect rapid pay increases or promotions.

summary: Great company
pros: They can do anything, there's infinite teams, if I don't like one I can go to another, great flexibility
cons: Everyday work kills some work life balance, so not competitive to other companies

summary: Good Career Entry Point / Bad Long Term Play
pros:
+ Great Benefits
+ High Comp
+ Learn a lot from other seniors as a L4
cons:
- Crap WLB
- Management is a lot of empire building and politics
- Direction in which org SMGS is way over indexed on Gen AI BS

summary: Good compensation but bad culture and poor work life balances
pros:
Good compensation 
Decent career growth 
Easy to move roles within the company
cons:
Bad work culture 
Poor work life balance
Heavily understaffed teams

summary: Good pay and good experience
pros: Higher than average pay on annual basis and good experience for growth.
cons: You will need to work hard and you will sacrifice work life balance.

summary: Only 3 months in, but so far, so good...
pros: Very above average compensation for my country + learning a lot + career progression seems promising.
cons: Some policies leaning  a little bit to the micromanagement side.

summary: Great career growth, poor WLB
pros: Great opportunity for career growth, chance to have big impact.
cons: Work life balance suffers as a trade off to this.

summary: Toxic leadership
pros: Nothing really, smart people in the past, but that’s gone
cons:
Very political and cut throat 
Risk averse
No career growth opportunities, but they’ll lure you for 4-5 years with no intention to pay you more

summary: Deadlines kills
pros: Comp is the only answer that feels right here .
cons: I don't even know what to do here there are so many things i can't fit

summary: Worst WLB, Pure management run company - Little to No respect for Most Engineers especially at L4/L5 level
pros:
Learning is good
Pay is decent
Depends on the team for good WLB
cons:
Depending on Managers, Everything else like:
Worse WLB
Toxic cut throat culture
Can’t say no to technically weak managers especially L5 managers

summary: A terrible place to be
pros:
- an opportunity to work on a high scale projects
- still paying lots for new hires
cons:
- annual TC reviews are just hilarious 
- RTO/RTH/no remote work anymore
- S-Team is completely detached from reality
reasonResign: The base salary after getting all stocks vested is just not worth of dealing with RTO

summary: Extremely poor work life balance.
pros: Great tech stack and opportunities. Lot of documentation available. Lot of available tools.
cons:
Poor work life balance.
No boundaries in management.
Very political environment.
Lot of stress .
Poor inter team collaboration.

summary: Teams vary greatly
pros: When you're in a good team with supportive and interested managers it can be a great place
cons: When there is stress, it get passed down from management

summary: Challenging Work life Balance
pros: Good monetary compensations than compared to other FAANG companies which give different sort of benefits over monetary compensation. Career growth is directly proportional to the best burnout limit.
cons: Burnout is quite common. You are chased by deadlines and focus

summary: good place, but very dependent on team
pros: nice benefits, wlb can be established if you are very clear with everyone
cons: management sometimes doesnt communicate clearly and people act like sharks

summary: Opportunities Are There, but Middle Management Needs to Support Growth.
pros: You have the opportunity to work with great people and contribute to multiple projects.
cons: A lot of middle management prioritizes personal career growth over team success, fostering an ‘I’ culture instead of a ‘we’ mentality.

summary: Not great, very dependant on team
pros: FAANG on resume, stock, some hard working and intelligent folks around
cons: RTO5. Lot of red tape. Bad, manipulative management. Limited career prospects depending on where in the world you are.
reasonResign: Geopolitics, manipulative and zero emotional intelligent management, with no growth support.

summary: Worst company to ever work for
pros:
- You get to lick Manager’s boots as they have a lot of power and ICs have no power.
- You know what bad companies are so you never work for any in future.
- You face cutthroat humiliation from everywhere teaching you that kindness is rare and helps you realise a lot of things.
cons:
- You have one bad day, they PIP you and lose your job. 
- No WLB, you are expected to work for the devil by selling your soul.
- Managers will tell you demeaning things and humiliate you, but will still get away because Amazon gives them tools for humiliation. Stay away from Amazon.

summary: Toxic
pros: Amazon brings Opportunities to dream big and make things happen.
cons: The S team does not care about employees or the employee experience at all. Toxic culture.
